title: El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro National Historic Trail: Weather
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Weather              Weather      Due to the length of El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro National Historic Trail, be sure to consult local weather sources for the region you'll be visiting. Here is a link for the Southwest US. www.accuweather.com/en/us/southwest-region/weather-radar         This museum offers the most extensive exhibits that exist on the trail. The historic trail site overlooks the northern end of the dry desert expanse of the Jornada del Muerto, the lower Rio Grande, and El Camino Real de Tierra Adentro. The remote desert location presents a sense of the climate and the long dusty trail endured by these early travelers, spending six months or longer on the trail to reach Santa Fe from Zacatecas, Mexico.
